title: The areas of triangles
description: Write a program to recurrently read the lengths of three edges, if the edges can form a triangle, output the area of the triangle, otherwise output “ The input is invalid”.
input: There are several test cases. Each test case contains three integers that stand for the lengths of three edges, separated by blanks. The input ends with “0”.
output:
For each case, output the value of area (set the precision as 2), or “ The input is invalid”.

At the end of the program, ouput the lengths of three edges of the triangle with the largest area.
sample_output:
6.00
The input is invalid
The largest triangle is: 3 4 5
hint: For a triangle with three edges a, b, and c, its area is the square root of p(p-a)(p-b)(p-c), where p = (a+b+c)/2.
